content.text: Checks if a parent element contains a child element (excluding self-containment)
True if parent contains child (but parent !== child), false otherwise
Throws if parent or child is null/undefined
- Browser support: IE 9+, all modern browsers

summary.text: The potential child element to check for

text.comment: The potential child element to check for

Description:

Checks if a parent element contains a child element (excluding self-containment)

Returns:

True if parent contains child (but parent !== child), false otherwise

Throws:

Throws if parent or child is null/undefined

Example:
// Basic containment check
const container = document.getElementById('container');
const button = document.querySelector('.submit-button');
if (elementContains(container, button)) {
  console.log('Button is inside container');
}
Example:
// Event delegation - check if clicked element is within a specific area
document.addEventListener('click', (event) => {
  const sidebar = document.getElementById('sidebar');
  if (elementContains(sidebar, event.target)) {
    console.log('Clicked inside sidebar');
  }
});
Example:
// Accessibility - check if focused element is within a modal
const modal = document.querySelector('[role="dialog"]');
const focusedElement = document.activeElement;
if (!elementContains(modal, focusedElement)) {
  // Return focus to modal if it escaped
  modal.querySelector('[tabindex="0"]')?.focus();
}
Since:

1.0.0

See:
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node/contains - Browser support: IE 9+, all modern browsers
  • https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/practices/keyboard-interface/ - ARIA keyboard navigation practices
  • https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/dialog-modal/ - Modal dialog accessibility patterns
